item.title: Palestinian filmmaker showcases the beauty of pre-war Gaza
item.content:encoded: Palestinian journalist Yousef Al Helou documented Gaza and its people in 2023, months before the start of Israel’s war,

item.title: Lebanon’s second airport could receive passengers by summer, officials say
item.content:encoded: Lebanon has long discussed opening a second airport. As the political debate has faded, the possibility is near.

item.title: Displaced Sudanese women caught up in war suffer wretched Ramadan
item.content:encoded: Women in Sudan’s Al-Sarraf camp face hunger and disease during a desperate holy month.

item.title: Calls for justice grow after Israeli settlers kill another US citizen
item.content:encoded: Rights advocates say US envoy Mike Huckabee has failed to push for accountability for Israeli abuses against Americans.

item.title: Commons Speaker says he tipped off police about Mandelson ahead of arrest
item.content:encoded: British House of Commons Speaker Lindsay Hoyle says he passed information about Peter Mandelson to Metropolitan Police.

item.title: India vs Zimbabwe: T20 World Cup Super Eights – teams, start, lineups
item.content:encoded: India and Zimbabwe are both in need to a Super Eights win to keep alive T20 World Cup semifinal dream.

item.title: Pakistani players in the Hundred: What’s the cricket controversy all about?
item.content:encoded: Breaking down row involving Pakistani cricketers' presence in a franchise league in which Indian businesses own teams.

item.title: UN: 6.5 million in Somalia facing hunger
item.content:encoded: The UN is warning 6.5 million people in Somalia are facing extreme hunger, triggered by a prolonged drought.

item.title: Japan to install missiles near Taiwan: Are China tensions set to spike?
item.content:encoded: Japan plans to deploy missiles near Taiwan, a move analysts say risks deepening regional tensions with China.

item.title: Why Indian PM Modi’s Israel visit matters for Pakistan’s security
item.content:encoded: The tightening strategic embrace between New Delhi and Tel Aviv could test Pakistan's diplomacy, say analysts.

item.title: Thousands join Manila corruption protest on 40th anniversary of uprising
item.content:encoded: In the Philippines, thousands of protesters clashed with police in Manila on the 40th anniversary of a popular uprising.

item.title: Anthropic vs the Pentagon: Why AI firm is taking on Trump administration
item.content:encoded: Anthropic was the first AI developer to be used in classified operations by the US Defense Department.

item.title: Four years into the Ukraine war, Moscow sees vindication, not failure
item.content:encoded: What many in the West viewed as a strategic blunder is increasingly seen in Moscow as a costly but necessary gamble.

item.title: Netanyahu greets Indian PM Modi as he lands in Israel
item.content:encoded: India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi was greeted by Benjamin Netanyahu in Israel.

item.title: How Putin stays strong in Russia, four years into war in Ukraine
item.content:encoded: The quick victory never came. But a functional economy, controlled media and slow battle gains give Putin control.

item.title: Military government air strikes kill 17 in western Myanmar state
item.content:encoded: Women and children among those killed in air strikes on a village market in Rakhine.

item.title: What Trump said at State of the Union address
item.content:encoded: US President Donald Trump’s State of the Union address both aggravated and excited lawmakers.

item.title: Zimbabwe imposes ban on exports of all raw minerals and lithium concentrate
item.content:encoded: The immediate ban covers all raw minerals already in transit and will remain in place until further notice.

item.title: Deadly fighting in Alawite heartland city in Syria
item.content:encoded: Several people were killed in fighting in Syria’s Latakia where suspected Assad regime supporters attacked security.

item.title: ‘Anti-Palestinian repression’: Legal experts document hundreds of UK cases
item.content:encoded: Group says its new public database, including examples of students and activists, reveals extent of broad crackdown.

item.title: Will Ethiopia be part of Israel’s ‘hexagon’ alliance rivalling its enemies?
item.content:encoded: Israeli President Herzog is in Addis Ababa days after high-level delegations from Turkiye and Saudi Arabia also visited.

item.title: How banks, billionaires aided Epstein after his 2008 conviction
item.content:encoded: Federal documents reveal how financiers, billionaires and major banks remained intertwined with Epstein for years.

item.title: FIFA’s Infantino plays down World Cup concerns despite violence in Mexico
item.content:encoded: Violence has broken out across Mexico, raising concerns only four months before its co-hosting of FIFA World Cup 2026.

item.title: T20 World Cup: Which teams can qualify for the semifinals and how?
item.content:encoded: Al Jazeera explains what India, Pakistan, Sri Lanka and the other four nations need to do to join England in the semis.

item.title: In Modi’s India, scandal still embarrasses but rape has become ordinary
item.content:encoded: The government’s performed outrage over Gates’s Epstein links underlined its indifference to violence against women.
